rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: A Blue bunny that may be used to attack any other Cathexis Bunny. Roll the die the same color as the bunny. The lower number must discard his bunny.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text:
When a Cathexis Bunny is placed in The Bunny Circle, all bunnies that are the same color (or half color) as the Cathexis Bunny are immediately repositioned into the player's area of The Bunny Circle. New bunnies entering The Bunny Circle that are the same color (or half color) as any Cathexis Bunny in play are not confiscated.

A Cathexis Bunny in The Bunny Circle may be used to attack any other Cathexis Bunny in The Bunny Circle. The current player may initiate an attack once per turn by announcing his target (another Cathexis Bunny). Each player will roll the 12-sided die that is the same color as the Cathexis Bunny involved in the attack. Next, each player will add +1 to the die roll number for each bunny he has in his area of The Bunny Circle that is the same color (or half color) as the Cathexis Bunny involved in the attack. The Cathexis Bunny is itself counted, and also adds +1 to the die roll number.

The player with the lower final number must discard his Cathexis Bunny along with all other bunnies of the same color (or half color) and give the player with the higiher final number one of his Carrots. If both players total the same number, then all bunnies survive and both players must return one Carrot to any Kaballa's Market.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to choose a Carrot from Kaballa's Market

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to choose two Carrots from Kaballa's Market

title: Feed The Bunny – 1 Radish and 2 Milk

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must feed the amounts shown by the end of its next turn or die.

title: Feed The Bunny – 4 Radish and 3 Milk

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed on any bunny which must feed the amounts shown by the end of its next turn or die.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed under any Atomic Pastry (saved or in play) smothering it in chocolate and neutralizing its detonation capabilities.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: The Atomic Pastry may be removed by any player at any time and used to Feed The Bunny any amounts of Cabbage, Water, Radish or Milk.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to set the buying and selling price of all Metal to zero. When a Metal dice triple is rolled then Dice Station Zero is discarded.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: The current player may take all of the Metal cards (and coins) from Morden's Metals Exchange for no cost. Players may continue to roll the three Metal dice at the end of each turn during which a Carrot is taken, however, new prices may only go into effect if all three Metal dice roll the same number.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used by a player for one round of play who temporarily controls all of the game dice. if an opponent needs dice for a card or consequence then he must ask permission of the player

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: If the player does not allow the use of his dice, then cards played by opponents that require dice must be discarded. Although the player controls the White die, he may not use it himself. The player may prevent any opponent from re-rolling the three Metal dice. Diceman is discarded at the start of the player's next turn.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to cause any two Atomic Pastry under a single bunny to explode at full force.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once to force all players to vote on how the close their pants: Fasten Zip or Zip Fasten. All players in the majority may choose a Carrot from any Kaballa's Market.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text:
Players vote by placing a card from their five-card hand with either an Odd (Zip first) or Even (Fasten first) Card Identification Number face down on the table. Once all players have voted, the cards are revelaed. All players that voted in the majority may, in a clockwise fashion from the card player, choose a Carrot from any Kaballa's Market (while supplies last). If a majority does not exist, then no player may choose a Carrot.

The last Carrot in any Kaballa's Market may not be taken by a player participating in Fasten Zip, Zip Fasten.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be given to any player whose finances (Dolla and Metal) become worthless until he rolls a Hebdomad (a pair of 7s) on any two dice during a single card consequence.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to reposition all Funky Fungus Bunny Modifier cards under any bunny or bunnies in The Bunny Circle.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to move all Barriers to new positions in The Bunny Circle or into the Discard Pile

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to remove any three Atomic Pastry cards (saved or under a bunny).

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to roll the dice and to replace any of his six remaining cards with the top ten flavor cards from the Draw Pile if an 8, 6, 7, 5, 3, 0 and 9 are rolled.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed under any bunny. Lucky Horseshoe Decadruple lowers the level of any weapon by ten.

rules.title: 50/50 Weapons
rules.text: 50/50 Weapons are not affected by Horseshoe modifiers.

rules.title: Gender Weapons
rules.text: Gender Weapons are not affected by Horseshoe modifiers.

rules.title: Abduction
rules.text: Horseshoe modifiers are discarded when a bunny is abducted by Area 51 or the Mothership.

rules.title: Horseshoes and Hand Grenade
rules.text: Horseshoes and Hand Grenade can be used to kill Horseshoe Bunnies by forcing them to roll higher than their total number of horseshoes to survive.

rules.title: Bamboozled Blacksmith
rules.text: Bamboozled Blacksmith can be used to remove Horseshoes from a bunny.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: Oyster Cracker - Bunny Modifier may be placed under any bunny and may force that bunny to move to a vacant Bunderground Station when that Bunderground Station in activated. A Bunderground Station is activated when any player rolls a die with a matching color and number. When this happens, the player whose area of The Bunny Circle contains the Bunderground Station may re-position any bunny in The Bunny Circle with an Oyster Cracker Bunny Modifier onto the matching Bunderground Station.

rules.title: Abduction
rules.text: Oyster Cracker modifiers are discarded when a bunny is abducted by Area 51 or the Mothership.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player who has at least one Carrot witha number that is a perfect square, perfect cube or perfect penteract to immediately play, save or discard all of his remaining cards.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text:
The player must immediately draw replacement cards.

Perfect Squares:
  • 1 (Tucker)
  • 4 (Flo)
  • 9 (Norman)
  • 16 (Gus)
  • 25 (Melanie)
  • 36 (Neo)
  • 49
  • 64
  • 81
  • 100

Perfect Cubes:
  • 1 (Tucker)
  • 8 (Seth)
  • 27 (Amelia)
  • 64

Perfect Penteracts:
  • 1 (Tucker)
  • 32 (Vic)

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to take and save any Atomic Pastry in the top 20 cards of the Draw Pile.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to take one saved Atomic Pastry from each opponent. All Atomic Pastry must remain saved for one round of play.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player who owns the most KinderBunnies Carrots with vowel letters to take any one Bunderground Station, saved Atomic Pastry, Relative, saved alien ship, saved Planet card and Meta.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: If the Brown die rolled an odd number, then the letter Y may be used as a vowel, if no player has the most Carrots with vowel letters, then no player may take any items.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to re-arrange the positions of any two Atomic Pastry already under bunnies if a 2, 10, 10, and 10 are rolled on any of the dice. Each die may be rolled three times.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to force any one opponent to give all of his saved Atomic Pastry to other players.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be placed under any bunny and explodes when an identical Atomic Pastry is placed under the same bunny. The bunny must roll higher than 10 to survive. Adjacent bunnies must roll higher than 8 to survive.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text:
An Atomic Pastry may be placed under any bunny in The Bunny Circle and explodes with half force when any other (non identical) Atomic Pastry is placed under the same bunny. The target bunny must roll higher than 5 to survive, and adjacent bunnies must roll higher than 4 to survive.

A single Atomic Pastry may be exploded with full force under any bunny in The Bunny Circle that is wearing a shirt with an identical fruit symbol.

All Atomic Pastry are Special cards and may either be saved or immediately placed under any bunny in The Bunny Circle. A saved Atomic Pastry may only be placed under a bunny in The Bunny Circle during the turn of the player who owns the pastry.

Atomic Pastry explosions may eliminate bunnies, but they are not weapons. Therefore, cards that affect weapons will have no effect on an Atomic Pastry. Atomic Pastry explosions are not affected by a Barrier or a Neutronium Barrier. If a bunny is abducted by aliens, then all Atomic Pastry under the bunny are consumed immediately by the aliens (discarded).

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to feed the bunny. One bunny is fed any amounts of Cabbage Units, Water Units, Radish Units and Milk Units.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to feed the bunny. One bunny is fed any amounts of Cabbage Units, Water Units, Radish Units and Milk Units.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: The player with this card saved may play any non-atomic pastry as an Atomic Pastry. If at any time the player has no bunnies in The Bunny Circle then Fruit Seeking Neutrons is discarded.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: The player with this card saved may play any non-atomic pastry (Mini Danish, Large Prune Danish, Very Large Prune Danish, Strawberry Tart, Chocolate Eclair, Jumbo Chocolate Eclair) as an Atomic Pastry. Two non-atomic pastry being played as Atomic Pastry will need to be identical to explode (at full force).

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: The player with this card saved may stop all Atomic Pastry detonations on any of his bunnies. If at any time the player has no bunnies in The Bunny Circle then Yamok Sauce is discarded.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: Atomic Pastry remain under the player's bunnies and explode immediately if the player loses Yamok Sauce.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to immediately kill a bunny that has just fed. May be used at any time!

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to force the first opponent to consult the Instructions or Bunny Bits to immediately discard all of his bunnies in The Bunny Circle. Must be used during the same turn that the consultation is made!

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: May be used once by a player to force the first opponent to consult any of the Killer Bunnies (or KinderBunnies) Instructions, Bunny Bits, or any other independent reference material (including this app) to immediately discard all of his bunnies in The Bunny Circle. Must be used during the same turn that the consultation is made!

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by a player to take all saved prime-numbered Carrots from his opponents. may be played only at three minutes to midnight: 23:57

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: May be used once by the player who can form the longest word using the letters on his saved Carrots to choose a Carrot from any Kaballa's Market.

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: Dr. Shoe may be used once by the player who can form the longest word within one minute using the letters on his saved KinderBunnies Carrots to choose a Carrot from any Kaballa’s Market. Only the single letter designations of KinderBunnies Carrots may be used (the letters in the names of any Carrots may not be used). If there is a tie for the longest word, then no player may choose a Carrot.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: A duo of dinosaurs enacts a tetherball dido using one of your bunnies as the ball!

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: If a player draws a PLAY IMMEDIATELY card but has no bunny in The Bunny Circle, then he must place the card on an opponent's bunny in The Bunny Circle causing it to die (discarded). This is also true if the player's only bunny in The Bunny Circle is protected by The Heavenly Halo or Angel Wings

rules.title: Protection
rules.text: The Heavenly Halo and Angel Wings will protect a bunny from any terrible misfortune. The Guardian Angle can be used to eliminate a Terrible Misfortune.

rules.title: Card Text
rules.text: While on safari in Africa, one of your bunnies is crushed after an anserous musth!

rules.title: Additional Rules
rules.text: If a player draws a PLAY IMMEDIATELY card but has no bunny in The Bunny Circle, then he must place the card on an opponent's bunny in The Bunny Circle causing it to die (discarded). This is also true if the player's only bunny in The Bunny Circle is protected by The Heavenly Halo or Angel Wings

rules.title: Protection
rules.text: The Heavenly Halo and Angel Wings will protect a bunny from any terrible misfortune. The Guardian Angle can be used to eliminate a Terrible Misfortune.

rules.title: Bunderground Station
rules.text:
When a Bundergound Station card is drawn, it is immediately placed into any player's area of The Bunny Circle. Usually a player will place it into his own area of The Bunny Circle, but a player may chose to place it into an opponent;'s area. A Bunderground Station does not count as a 'space' in The Bunny Circle, and weapons that affect adjacent bunnies to not 'see' a Bunderground Station. A Bunderground Station cannot be directly targeted by a weapon.

Every Bundergound Station has a color (or line) and a number. Each time that the die with the corresponding color is rolled, all players must check to see if a Bunderground Station located in their area of The Gunny Circle has the matching number. If it does, then the player may move any bunny with an Oyster Cracker or an Oyster Cracker Bunny Modifier card from any position in The Bunny Circle and place it onto the matching (color and number) Bunderground Station.

A Bundergound Station must be vacant to receive a new bunny. A bunny already on a Bunderground Station cannot be exchanged for a new one. A bunny on a Bunderground Station counts as a 'space' in The Bunny Circle. A bunny on a Bunderground Station may be directly targeted by any weapon, and weapons that affect adjacent bunnies can 'see' these bunnies. A player may move a bunny that is already on a Bunderground Station to a vacant Bunderground Station. All bunny movements occur at the end of The current player's turn.

For example, if Carol has the Red Centralized Line Bunderground Station #03 - Smile End in her area of The Bunny Circle, then anytime that any player rolls a 3 on the Red die, Carol may move any bunny with an Oyster Cracker or Oyster Cracker Bunny Modifier card from any position in The Bunny Circle onto Smile End. Of course, Smile End must be vacant to receive a new bunny.

Of course, Smile End must be vacant to receive a new bunny.
